author: .paulharris
content:
<@!144468805697929216> issue for 414 error is https://github.com/PegaSysEng/teku/issues/2838 - would be interested to see if header limits hit each client, and at what size - our limit is 8k inherited from the jetty webserver as its default limit.
i wrote a quick script that assumes 200 char overhead for header, then adds indexes randomly generated from 1-100000, and i got to 1358 indexes before i hit the 8k limit... not sure of header limits for all the other clients, but it looks like around 1300 duties per request would work, but above that you may hit url length limits with teku as it stands
(side note, my numbers only counted a comma as 1 char, so these numbers are super optimistic ğŸ˜¦ )

author: .paulharris
content: i'm fairly comfortable to raise the limit to something like x3 that, (24k request header) which would be closer to 4100 indexes, just not sure if thats an adequate limit, or we want it arbitrarily large... if we want it arbitrary, may be better off considering the attester duties becomes a `POST` depending on  the limitations of other other clients
